title: Social Presence and Cognitive Load Management Strategies in Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning experience and intermediate mathematical problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: A corporate university-operated mathematics job training program with project-based assessments in a BYOD environment, prioritizing content comprehension and interaction over technological accessibility due to the learners' age demographics.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more communication techniques that enhance social presence
Learners improve their ability to analyze math problems by applying cognitive load theory (intrinsic/extraneous/germane)
Learners complete a project analyzing the correlation between social presence and cognitive load based on survey results
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
